intro: Erigeron pusillus, commonly known as the small fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron pusillus is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to thrive in dry conditions.
